{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3572318,"name":"Jared Forchheimer","username":"Jared2534","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/j/c67d28/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-03-29T16:58:58.915Z","cooked":"

I am trying to get our robot to PathFindToPose using the pose2d nearest function. Our goal pose is updating, but for some reason the PathFindToPose function always ends up at the same goal pose spot. Our github is 2025_Official/src/main/java/frc/robot/subsystems/DriveTrain.java at Limelight-tID · BLlakers/2025_Official · GitHub

Thank you all for the help.

Which spot does it go to?

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":8,"updated_at":"2025-03-29T23:32:42.594Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":44,"readers_count":43,"score":8.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":497330,"topic_slug":"issue-with-pathfindtopose-not-updating-out-goal-position","display_username":"icemannie","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":28240,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/issue-with-pathfindtopose-not-updating-out-goal-position/497330/2","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3572605,"name":"Jared Forchheimer","username":"Jared2534","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/j/c67d28/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-03-29T23:58:32.321Z","cooked":"

I figured this issue out. It only created the command one time and didn’t supply the pose, so it only went to one pose. I used the defer command to have it supply. Now I am running into issues with the robots orientation. Our pose estimator still isn’t giving us accurate rotation. Check my first post for more context. How do teams start not square? If you know the answer please respond. Thanks again

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":8,"updated_at":"2025-03-29T23:58:32.321Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":38,"readers_count":37,"score":12.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":497330,"topic_slug":"issue-with-pathfindtopose-not-updating-out-goal-position","display_username":"Jared Forchheimer","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":74637,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/issue-with-pathfindtopose-not-updating-out-goal-position/497330/3","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3572615,"name":"SLAB-Mr.Thomas","username":"SLAB-Mr.Thomas","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/slab-mr.thomas/{size}/182153_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-30T00:08:51.985Z","cooked":"
Jared2534:

How do teams start not square?

I presume you want to set your gyro to the correct angle to the field. Drive team practices being careful to measure by some means the exact initial pose. Use field tape, measuring tools and we use one Coral length in some situations.

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":8,"updated_at":"2025-03-30T00:08:51.985Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":3,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":30,"readers_count":29,"score":11.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":497330,"topic_slug":"issue-with-pathfindtopose-not-updating-out-goal-position","display_username":"SLAB-Mr.Thomas","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":24594,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/issue-with-pathfindtopose-not-updating-out-goal-position/497330/4","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3572620,"name":"Jared Forchheimer","username":"Jared2534","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/j/c67d28/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-03-30T00:11:07.266Z","cooked":"

Is there anything in my code that I have to do in order to get an accurate field relative angle with our pose-estimator on initialization? Do I need to reset the gyro/ set angle adjustment for it?

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":8,"updated_at":"2025-03-30T00:11:07.266Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":4,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":24,"readers_count":23,"score":9.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":497330,"topic_slug":"issue-with-pathfindtopose-not-updating-out-goal-position","display_username":"Jared Forchheimer","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":24594,"username":"SLAB-Mr.Thomas","name":"SLAB-Mr.Thomas","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/slab-mr.thomas/{size}/182153_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":74637,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/issue-with-pathfindtopose-not-updating-out-goal-position/497330/5","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3572622,"name":"SLAB-Mr.Thomas","username":"SLAB-Mr.Thomas","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/slab-mr.thomas/{size}/182153_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-30T00:15:05.364Z","cooked":"

We want the gyro 0 to point straight downfield blue to red. If the robot isn’t pointing that way initially then we have to initialize the gyro to the true robot angle which we are very careful to setup.

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":8,"updated_at":"2025-03-30T00:15:05.364Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":5,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":23,"readers_count":22,"score":24.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":497330,"topic_slug":"issue-with-pathfindtopose-not-updating-out-goal-position","display_username":"SLAB-Mr.Thomas","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":74637,"username":"Jared2534","name":"Jared Forchheimer","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/j/c67d28/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":24594,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/issue-with-pathfindtopose-not-updating-out-goal-position/497330/6","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3572632,"name":"Jared Forchheimer","username":"Jared2534","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/j/c67d28/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-03-30T00:19:09.069Z","cooked":"

So your saying teams are not able to start their robot at an 60• angle facing let’s say tag 20? If we want to set our robots rotation 2d to its actual field rotation2d in the pose estimator how do we do that? Again thank you very much for the help I genuinely really appreciate it.

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":8,"updated_at":"2025-03-30T00:19:09.069Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":6,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":20,"readers_count":19,"score":9.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":497330,"topic_slug":"issue-with-pathfindtopose-not-updating-out-goal-position","display_username":"Jared Forchheimer","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":24594,"username":"SLAB-Mr.Thomas","name":"SLAB-Mr.Thomas","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/slab-mr.thomas/{size}/182153_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":74637,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/issue-with-pathfindtopose-not-updating-out-goal-position/497330/7","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3572639,"name":"SLAB-Mr.Thomas","username":"SLAB-Mr.Thomas","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/slab-mr.thomas/{size}/182153_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-30T00:27:54.627Z","cooked":"

You can reset odometry and pose estimator to any pose that you want to. You can setup the robot however you want. Use eyeballs, tools, field markings and AprilTags to do so accurately.
